• Do a systematic assessment, using the ESMOE approach (Big 5, forgotten 4)
• Examine th e abdomen:
o Inspect for previous scars, possible multiple pregnancy or abnormal lie
o Measure the symphysis-fundal height in centimeters
o Determine the fetal lie (longitudinal, oblique or transverse), presentation (cephalic or breech) and
attitude of the head (the amount of flexion or extension)
• Assess:
o Level of the head in fifths palpable above the pelvic brim
o Liquor volume (probably
